content:
I am! I think DAOs are really cool in theory but I'm not entirely sure of its real world applications. Humans, as a species, have congregated to survive so it's natural to put trust in a handful of individuals ala your village chiefs, leaders etc. It is also more efficient to have to come to a consensus between fewer people.

That said, I think there's still a lot we can do with DAOs, specifically on incentivisation and reputation.

author: austinhx
content: I had a question about the acceptance process, is it accepted solely based on application or will there be an interview step as well?

author: pipermerriam
content:
There will be an initial round of filtering and then we'll do interviews.

But I'd like to highlight that being "selected" into the program is really just the group that we'll be working directly with to provide funding.  The program is going to happen in the "open" meaning that anyone who wants to participate can be a part of the program on the same footing as those that are "selected".  So being selected or not selected .... you can still do this.

And we're looking into how we can provide some support for those that don't get selected but who choose to be apart of the program anyways.  There will probably be an opportunity for those that aren't selected but who do need funding to do this realistically to apply for a grant.

author: pipermerriam
content: <@!429611433685417986> the program is going to be highly self directed.  As long as you set the expectation up front for what your availability is, I don't see any problems.  There will not be any sort of rigid curriculum.  The one "hitch" I see is that we are intending to team people up which will leave your teammate alone for whatever time you are gone. author: pipermerriam
content:
If you're interested in EIP editing, I'd encourage you to reach out to <@!301186049323958275> . 

As for your question, there's no wrong answer there.  I'm expecting people to have a very broad range of answers for that question.  Some people know very little about the protocol and thus know almost nothing about what problems there are... someone who knows a lot may already have a project in mind... both are ok.

author: pipermerriam
content:
Assuming this question means, how many do we expect to "accept".  For this first cohort, the number that we formally accept is going to be very small.  I'm hesitant to give an exact number but very likely no more than 6.  This is the first time we're doing this.  There's going to be things that we get wrong.  There's going to be stuff that we figure out as we go.  If the program is working, we'll start the second cohort midway through the program so that there is overlap and the first cohort can help onboard the second cohort.

But I'll encourage you to read what I wrote here: https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/843176491386667018/844249020259369030

Being "accepted" mostly just means that we'll be helping make sure you can pay your bills and feed yourself so that you can put your focus towards the program.  There will be nothing stopping anyone from participating whether they are accepted or not.
